data.title: 25 Years of Lighting Springsteen - PLSN.com
data.text: Buyers Guide: Roofing Structures, page 25 Vol. 10.4 25 Years of Lighting Springsteen Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band’s tour in support of Working on a Dream is the culmination of 25 years of experience that lighting designer Jeff Ravitz brings to the table. The totally fog and haze-free show is a masterpiece of lighting using color and angles to underscore the emotion of the music. In the first Springsteen tour with non-IMAG video imagery, a low profile LED display backs the low-key set and provides not only color and graphics, but also acts as a light source at times. The IMAG screens on either side of the stage along with the video backdrop all work with the lighting to reinforce the energy of the music. The lighting rig is a combination of moving lights, a few conventionals and several followspots, all orchestrated by lighting directors Todd Ricci and John Hoffman. Hoffman runs an MA Lighting grandMA while Ricci operates an Avolites Diamond 2 console and calls followspots. Joining the lighting crew at the FOH position is Russ Hochstedler, who runs the Green Hippo Hippotizer media server, while video director Chris Hilsson resides in video world. For the full story, turn to Production Profile, page 20. IATSE Announces Agreement with NETworks LLC NEW YORK — The IATSE has negotiated an agreement on behalf of backstage workers traveling with touring productions produced by NETworks, LLC. The collective bargaining agreement applies to five shows currently touring through the U.S. and Canada for their 2009/2010 seasons — Sweeney Todd, The Drowsy Chaperone, Hairspray, The Wizard of Oz and Annie. The agreement also applies to seven forthcoming NETworks productions. “This agreement will provide meaningful benefits to NETworks’ crews,” said Matthew Loeb, IATSE International president. “It also secures this work under IATSE jurisdiction and expands our presence in the one-night and split-week touring markets.” MAY 2009 RCF Group Buys Majority Stake in SGM TAVULLIA, Italy — RCF Group has purchased 51 percent of SGM Technology for Lighting S.p.A., based here. RCF, a public company listed on the Milan stock exchange, was formed by the companies RCF and AEB (dB Technologies). “It is a great opportunity to us to become one of the companies of the RCF Group,” said Gabriele Giorgi, managing director of SGM. “Over the years we have built a very dedicated team and, together with our worldwide distribution partners, we have significantly expanded our international sales. “Looking ahead we felt it was time to structure our company for a more demanding market and, being part of larger group, will provide SGM with immediate access to additional technical and financial resources,” continued on page 6 Mike Murphy Named President of J. R. Clancy, Inc. SYRACUSE, NY — Mike Murphy, executive vice president of J. R. Clancy, Inc., has been named president of the rigging design and manufacturing company. A veteran of the theatre rigging industry for more than 30 years, Murphy joined J. R. Clancy 12 years ago. His responsibilities have included administration of Clancy’s International Standards Organization (ISO) 9001 activities, making him responsible for the development and implementation of Clancy’s quality management program. continued on page 5 36 38 40 PROJECTION CONNECTION Starts on page 31 Old School Looks, Timeless Appeal DAVID SCHEINMANN In an era of movie and musical retreads, Billy Elliot: the Musical is not the kind of show you’d think you would enjoy, yet you do. Broadway’s take on the well-known tale of a boy born to dance in a mining-town milieu gets a classic theatrical look with veteran LD Rick Fisher’s old-school approach to new gear. Although the rig is dominated by moving lights, you might not know it from watching the show. “You rarely see a light just come up in one place and be one thing and then morph into something else,” Fisher says. “Hopefully, when it does that, it does that more for an emotional reason than to mark a beat with music.” For more, turn to page 18.
